definitions.definition: a strong heavy rough material used for making tents, sails, etc. and by artists for painting on
definitions.labels: (US English)(US English)(US English)(especially British English)(North American English usually)(British English)(North American English)

definitions.definition: a piece of canvas used for painting on; a painting done on a piece of canvas, using oil paints

examples.text: a sale of the artist’s early canvases

definitions.definition: a person or thing that has the potential to be developed or changed in many different ways

examples.text: The building is a blank canvas for a clever investor to potentially make a lot of money.
Alice was a blank slate in the first film because she had memory loss and knew nothing about herself.
They spent the night under canvas.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old Northern French canevas, based on Latin cannabis ‘hemp’, from Greek.
